defect: Lack of identity testing for diethylene glycol (DEG) in glycerin
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm failed to withhold each lot of components, drug product containers, and closures until tested and released, and lacked a specific identity test to detect diethylene glycol (DEG) in glycerin shipments.

filename: Tianjin Bolang Science-Technology Development Co. Ltd._2886.html
defect: Lack of design control procedures and activities for the device.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The firm’s response is not adequate because it failed to provide details on processes, work operations, quality records, and other quality data necessary for a retrospective review and did not ensure the availability of complaint procedure and records for review.

defect: Leaking administration sets with compromised filter integrity.
claimed_cause: Device not returned; no cause established.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a thorough evaluation of complaints due to failure to return devices for testing and insufficient documentation of any additional investigative efforts.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of omissions, alterations, deletions, record destruction, and other deficiencies within the facility’s operations regarding data integrity.

defect: Cross-contamination from inadequate cleaning of drug products.
claimed_cause: Inadequate cleaning, shared equipment, and testing alone caused contamination.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to adequately consider all impacted batches, manufacturing equipment, and testing methods used to release contaminated drug products.

defect: Delay in dispensing medications due to freezing, shutdown, or malfunction.
claimed_cause: Complaint investigations were not comprehensive, lacking detailed investigation and root cause analysis.
fda_critique: Failed to adequately investigate and address a significant number of complaints regarding medication dispensing delays, malfunctions, and potential patient safety issues, including those leading to life-threatening situations.

defect: High impurity concentration in API batches.
claimed_cause: Operator error during batch preparation, equipment malfunction, raw material contamination.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to extend its scope to all lots manufactured prior to August 2018, including those using the non-optimized manufacturing process.

defect: Benzene contamination in drug products at unacceptable levels.
claimed_cause: Operator error during propellant blending, inadequate testing, and flawed investigation scope.
fda_critique: Failed to thoroughly investigate any unexplained discrepancy or failure of a batch or its components to meet specifications, and did not expand its investigation to other propellants when information indicated benzene contamination in cosmetic products using a different propellant.

filename: Argon Medical Productions  Vertrieb Gesellschaft MBH  CO_852.html
defect: Failure of dental implants to osseointegrate
claimed_cause: Complaints due to patient-specific factors are not investigated.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to adequately investigate complaints involving device failures, such as osseointegration, and did not provide documentation or evidence of proposed corrective actions.

defect: Batch manufacturing records lacking complete information and data.
claimed_cause: Operator error and deficient data integrity practices.
fda_critique: Your quality unit failed to investigate and correct deficiencies in batch manufacturing record issuance and data integrity practices.

defect: Disparate API expiration dates for the same lot.
claimed_cause: Failure to investigate supplier complaints and assess API quality.
fda_critique: Failed to initiate an investigation to assess whether the change in expiration date for aminocaproic acid API was accurate and appropriate.

defect: Failed identification test - lacking infrared spectroscopy for Eucalyptus Oil
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked scientifically sound and appropriate specifications, standards, sampling plans, and test procedures designed to assure that components conform to appropriate standards of identity, strength, quality, and purity, and failed to include an identification test with adequate specificity for incoming Eucalyptus Oil.

defect: Out-of-range temperature in 2-8°C refrigerator compromising microorganisms.
claimed_cause: Failure to investigate temperature deviations, no root cause identified.
fda_critique: Failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained deviations in laboratory equipment, including temperature and humidity readings, and determine their potential impact on test results.

defect: Cross-contamination hazards from inadequate cleaning procedures.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of your cleaning effectiveness to evaluate the scope of cross-contamination hazards.

defect: Observed peak splitting during GC-MS method transfer.
claimed_cause: Dirty/deteriorated column was attributed as the root cause.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to consider all potential equipment sources contributing to the observed peak splitting during the method transfer.

defect: Microbial contamination in ManukaGuard Allercleanse nasal spray.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to extend the investigation to other batches and drug products associated with the microbial contamination.

defect: Lack of documented customer complaints for blood glucose monitoring systems
claimed_cause: Personnel unaware of complaint requirements, inadequate procedure.
fda_critique: Your firm did not adequately review communications, including those previously categorized as “inquires,” to determine if they should be retrospectively handled as complaints.

defect: Excessive aerobic plate counts and Burkholderia cepacia complex contamination.
claimed_cause: Lack of data; API supplier contamination of chlorhexidine gluconate.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to adequately address multiple potential root causes of the contamination, including deficiencies in your cleaning program and lacked justification for attributing the contamination solely to the API supplier’s issues.

defect: Inconsistent peak response in long-term dissolution samples.
claimed_cause: Interference from excipients and insufficient filter saturation.
fda_critique: You failed to provide scientific justification for concluding that extraneous peaks in stability samples were due to insufficient filter saturation, lacking an appropriate assessment of your procedures for investigating discrepancies.

defect: Objectionable microbial contamination
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked sufficient detail regarding the root causes of contamination and the identification of inadequacies of cleaning procedures.

defect: Data integrity lapses in records and reporting.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The company’s investigation failed to ensure adequate oversight and address critical deficiencies in its quality systems, including cleaning validation, stability programs, data integrity controls, and batch records.

defect: Raw material contamination with high-risk components.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a meaningful investigation into the trend of multiple mold recoveries, including a significant recovery of *Cladosporium*, and failed to open an investigation to examine other potentially adverse trends.

defect: Missing Quality Assurance and Reference Documentation in DMRs
claimed_cause: NOT STATED
fda_critique: The firm’s investigation lacked documented evidence of conducting quality audits to assure compliance with quality system requirements and determine system effectiveness.

defect: Water leaks from the purification system and valve leaks.
claimed_cause: Operator error due to lack of documented leak checks.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to adequately document and address water leaks within the purification system, presenting a potential entry point for microbial contamination.

defect: Unsuitable component water used in hand sanitizer formulation.
claimed_cause: Inadequate quality systems, failing to investigate test results.
fda_critique: The firm’s quality control unit failed to adequately investigate out-of-specification test results, reprocessing, and errant label reconciliation, and failed to establish and follow written procedures.

defect: Failure to investigate and report complaints related to laser device issues.
claimed_cause: Failure to investigate complaints; no root cause identified.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to maintain a record that includes the reason no investigation was made and the name of the individual responsible for the decision not to investigate.

defect: Data integrity lapses in records and reporting.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The company’s investigation failed to adequately ensure the accuracy and integrity of data to support the safety, effectiveness, and quality of the drugs it manufactures.

defect: Not specified
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm did not adequately establish and maintain procedures to ensure equipment is routinely calibrated, inspected, checked, and maintained, and failed to provide calibration documentation and data for key instruments.

defect: Out-of-specification assay testing failure at stability timepoint
claimed_cause: Microscopic packaging defects led to failure, no root cause.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked sufficient rigor to show how your “packaging defects” led to a failure in product quality and failed to initiate a CAPA.

filename: Professional Compounding Centers of America dba PCCA_3255.html
defect: Failure to ensure cleaning practices prevented contamination.
claimed_cause: Failure to ensure cleaning practices were adequate to prevent contamination
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a sufficient evaluation of the recurring CGMP deficiencies and failure to maintain complete data for API tested and distributed to the United States.

defect: Failing assay result for meradimate API and octisalate API.
claimed_cause: Heated filling nozzles at the start of production.
fda_critique: Failed to conduct a full-scale investigation, including evaluating the manufacturing process, to determine the root cause of the failing assay results and prevent recurrence.

defect: Multiple media fill failures - contaminated units
claimed_cause: Investigations had not been closed; failures were not addressed.
fda_critique: The company’s investigation lacked adequate scientific justification for invalidating media fill failures and failing to address the root cause of contamination events.

filename: Janssen Vaccines Corp. A Johnson  Johnson Company_228.html
defect: Cracked vial stoppers associated with human use factors.
claimed_cause: Human use factors, including container closure system assembly.
fda_critique: Your firm did not adequately investigate other human use factors, such as the effect of container closure systems, and lacked investigation of the potential effects of manufacturing factors.

defect: Insufficiently shallow sampling thief insertion causing extra force.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm failed to extend its investigation to all similarly impacted drug products and adequately assess other sources of variability.

defect: Mold, black specks, and discoloration on drug products
claimed_cause: Inadequate investigations attributed mold to customer handling/water leaks.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked a scientifically supported determination of root cause(s) and failed to include an evaluation of customer complaint samples.

defect: Unidentified visible residues on direct product contact surfaces.
claimed_cause: Inadequate cleaning, lack of QA oversight, and operational management failures.
fda_critique: Failed to provide a comprehensive, independent retrospective assessment of cleaning effectiveness to evaluate the scope of cross-contamination hazards and identify inadequacies of cleaning procedures and practices.

defect: Recurring failing microbial enumeration results exceeding limits.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigations into failing results did not identify the root cause of the failures, lacked an evaluation of the impact on distributed batches, and did not include appropriate CAPA.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm’s investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment and remediation plan to ensure adequate investigation competencies, scope determination, root cause evaluation, and CAPA effectiveness.

defect: Taper post misalignment, mislabeled stems, and incorrect stem sizes
claimed_cause: Firm’s SOP is ambiguous and subjective.
fda_critique: The firm’s investigation lacked assurance that it will make appropriate decisions following 21 CFR 806 in the future, based on a root cause stating that the firm’s SOP is ambiguous and subjective.

defect: Out-of-limit (OOL) results for microbial content
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to provide a comprehensive, independent assessment of the overall system for investigating deviations and out-of-specification results, including a detailed action plan.

defect: Missing testing records and out-of-specification (OOS) investigations
claimed_cause: Inadequate investigations, missing records, no root cause identified.
fda_critique: Your investigations lacked adequate root cause determinations, corrective action and preventive action (CAPA), and effectiveness checks.

defect: Dissolution failures for potassium chloride ER capsules
claimed_cause: Raw material contamination from API
fda_critique: Your investigation did not adequately determine root cause(s) of your repeated dissolution failures during long-term stability testing, failing to consider all potassium chloride ER capsule process changes that may have impacted the dissolution results.

defect: Lubricant contamination with a non-food grade lubricant.
claimed_cause: Your firm concluded only Lot (b)(4) was impacted, no CAPA required.
fda_critique: Failed to perform adequate investigations and expand investigations to all batches and drug products that may have been impacted from contamination by machinery lubricant.

defect: Foreign tablets detected in repackaged drug products.
claimed_cause: Operator error during batch preparation, equipment design flaws.
fda_critique: Failed to extend the investigation to determine whether other batches may also have been impacted.

defect: Dimensional deviation of the product components
claimed_cause: Events caused by employees, equipment, document failure, or other causes.
fda_critique: Your firm’s investigation lacked adequate documentation of investigation, implementation of corrective actions, and distribution of quality issues to relevant personnel.

defect: Delayed complaint investigations leading to device failures.
claimed_cause: Calibration drift in analytical equipment.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked timely and thorough investigation of complaints, failing to follow established protocols and assign responsibility for engineering reviews within required timeframes.

defect: Vial breakage leading to media spill and contamination.
claimed_cause: Vial breakage led to media spill contamination, operators unconsidered.
fda_critique: Failed to adequately consider operators as the likely source of contamination and did not investigate potential design flaws contributing to the contamination.

defect: Bacterial endotoxin (BET) result exceeding specification limits
claimed_cause: Transcription error due to a different lot’s result.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked sufficient analysis of the transcription error and failure to identify all potential causes of nonconforming product.

defect: Out-of-specification active ingredient content test results.
claimed_cause: There was never a formal procedure for Data Integrity.
fda_critique: Your quality system did not adequately ensure the accuracy and integrity of data to support the safety, effectiveness, and quality of the drugs you manufacture.

defect: Inadequate specifications and testing for component water.
claimed_cause: Lack of adequate water specifications and monitoring.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked adequate specifications, standards, and testing for the water system, including limits and testing for objectionable microorganisms and conductivity, leading to failures in monitoring and ensuring water met Purified Water USP specifications.

defect: Bioresonance Focused Ultrasound Generator claims of healing conditions.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked scientific justification for claims regarding the effectiveness of the devices in treating diseases like cancer and Alzheimer’s.

defect: Out-of-specification assay results for OTC drug batches.
claimed_cause: Operator error (allowing average results) and failure to investigate.
fda_critique: The firm failed to initiate timely investigations to determine root causes and assess the impact of out-of-specification (OOS) assay results, and did not implement appropriate corrective actions to mitigate recurrence.

defect: Extrinsic mammalian hair contamination in vials and stoppers
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigations frequently lacked data supporting the assigned root cause(s), were not adequately expanded to include all potentially affected drug products.

defect: Sterility failures of Mueller Hinton Agar lots
claimed_cause: Failure to validate processes, analyze data, and implement procedures.
fda_critique: The company’s investigation lacked adequate analysis of quality data and failure to investigate and identify actions needed to correct and prevent the recurrence of product sterility failures.

defect: Invalidated OOS (in-process and release/stability testing) results
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to adequately address how you will implement systems to identify and address adverse laboratory incident trends and provide an overall management strategy for improving all phases of your laboratory investigations.

filename: Miami University Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry_2376.html
defect: Lack of conclusive, quantitative data for heparin elements.
claimed_cause: Data manipulation motivated by avoiding reanalysis was the root cause.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked conclusive, quantitative data for any of the elements reported, indicating the product had not been adequately analyzed for pharmaceutical quality.

defect: Cracked, broken, or leaking syringes during use.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to properly investigate customer complaints regarding quality issues and cracks/breakage in syringes from Jiangsu Shenli.

defect: Missing documentation for key quality system requirements
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The company’s investigation lacked documentation to establish requirements across key areas of its Quality System, as mandated by 21 CFR 820.

defect: Possible failure of a device to meet specifications
claimed_cause: “Root cause: lack of complaint investigation procedures”
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked the requirement to investigate complaints involving device failures, labeling, or packaging issues, regardless of whether they caused injury, illness, or death.

defect: Subpotent API concentration in bulk drug product.
claimed_cause: API “evaporation” was not scientifically supported.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained discrepancies and failures in drug products, including the subpotent API batch, and did not identify a scientifically supported root cause or implement appropriate corrective actions.

defect: Electrical nonfunctional motor failures in the motor article.
claimed_cause: Lack of knowledge and training regarding CAPA requirements.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive review of all test equipment to ensure suitability and validity of results.

defect: Failing to examine incoming components & release testing.
claimed_cause: Inadequate QU oversight, failing to examine components, release testing.
fda_critique: Your firm’s investigations lacked adequate procedures and a thorough evaluation of potential causes, particularly regarding the failure to examine incoming components and perform release testing prior to product release.

filename: Taizhou Kangping Medical Science and Technology Co. Ltd._132.html
defect: Exceeding allowable concentration of active ingredient in product.
claimed_cause: Lack of validated controls, shared access, and unretained spreadsheets.
fda_critique: The firm’s investigation lacked sufficient controls over data acquisition systems and failed to ensure the accuracy and integrity of data to support product safety, effectiveness, and quality.

filename: Dunagin Pharmaceuticals Inc. dba Massco Dental_1819.html
defect: Out-of-specification (OOS) finished drug product assay results
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigation did not include sufficient detail as to the possible scope and probable root cause for the OOS results observed during the inspection.

defect: Sterility failure – contaminated with Herbaspirillum aquaticum bacterium.
claimed_cause: Poor aseptic behavior by personnel, very low risk.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to thoroughly address the persistent adverse trend of microorganisms recovered from ISO 5 areas, including spore-forming bacteria and fungi, and did not consider that this sterility failure may be indicative of contamination risks from the basic design of your processing lines.

defect: BCC organisms detected in docusate sodium drug products
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigations lacked sufficient detail regarding the root causes of contamination and failed to adequately study the ability of your system to inhibit objectionable organisms.

defect: Out-of-specification assay results for zinc oxide in sunscreen.
claimed_cause: Sampling error and non-homogenous blending sample caused the failures.
fda_critique: Your investigations into OOS laboratory results lacked scientifically supported conclusions, corrective actions, and preventive actions, and failed to adequately identify the root cause and assess whether other batches were affected.

defect: Failed gluteal implant implantation, removal due to inflammation, and device breakage.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm did not adequately investigate complaints, failing to document the nature of investigations, results, and justifications for not investigating, as demonstrated by missing or incomplete documentation of key complaints.

defect: Inadequate curing of the adhesive bonding/gluing process.
claimed_cause: No requirement to record curing time/cleaning parameters.
fda_critique: Failed to adequately document and address critical process parameters like curing time and ultrasonic cleaning parameters within Design History Records.

defect: Released sterile products to inventory without sterilization COPs.
claimed_cause: Limited resources, training, storage, and sterilization label deficiencies.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a thorough validation of the sterilization process due to the failure to fully verify results and implement established procedures.

defect: Microbial growth (yeast and mold) detected in drug products.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to establish an adequate quality control unit with the responsibility and authority to oversee manufacturing and ensure product quality.

defect: Container-closure defects (neck leaks and valves) in medical gases.
claimed_cause: Operator error, documentation discrepancies, and failure to investigate issues.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to thoroughly investigate manufacturing and testing discrepancies, including recurrent container-closure defects and instances of missing or inaccurate documentation, demonstrating a lack of adequate investigation into critical quality issues.

defect: Contaminated media fill units with multiple microbial growth detected
claimed_cause: Damaged filling manifold valve contaminated during cleaning.
fda_critique: Your investigations into the media fill failures lacked sufficient rigor in determining root causes and scope of impact, failing to adequately address potential issues with sterilization cycle design and equipment contamination.

defect: Exposed facial skin and hair entering ISO 5 area.
claimed_cause: Operator error, inadequate procedures, and failure to follow aseptic practices.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to adequately address the contamination hazards stemming from personnel behavior within the ISO 5 area, specifically regarding gowning and glove usage.

defect: Microbiological out-of-limit results from the water system.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive review for potentially affected products, a root cause determination, and supporting documentation to identify the fundamental flaws in the water system’s design, control, and maintenance contributing to the OOL results.

defect: Out-of-specification assay results for suppository batches.
claimed_cause: Improper processing of injection, HPLC inhibition, no root cause.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to provide scientific justification to invalidate OOS results and release batches, lacking root cause identification and appropriate corrective action.

defect: Particulate matter in endotoxin testing wells
claimed_cause: Environmental and laboratory conditions, particulate matter source undefined.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained OOS endotoxin testing results, including multiple invalidated tests, without definitively identifying the source of particulate matter and implementing scientifically justified corrective actions.

defect: Dissolved oxygen content outside specification in G6 sensors.
claimed_cause: Inconsistent monitoring, notification, and scrapping of affected sensors.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked adequate evaluation of the potential for compression artifacts to cause delayed or missed low glucose alarms, particularly given the cited literature's findings.

defect: Out-of-specification CHG assay results in Prevantics Swabstick and Swab batches.
claimed_cause: Pipetting error or incorrect dilution without evidence.
fda_critique: Your investigations into OOS test results were inadequate because you failed to thoroughly investigate root causes, expand investigations to affected batches, implement CAPA, and evaluate its effectiveness.

defect: Not specified
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The company failed to adequately test samples of each component, including propylene glycol, for identity and conformity with specifications, specifically lacking a USP limit test for diethylene glycol or ethylene glycol.

defect: Inaccuracies in data records and reporting
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked a comprehensive evaluation of the extent of inaccuracies in data records and reporting, including a detailed description of root causes.

defect: Gross mold contamination in Potassium Sulfate, USP lot 36830004
claimed_cause: Inadequate investigation, failure to expand scope, root cause not stated.
fda_critique: The investigation was inadequate because it did not extend to other potentially affected batches and failed to fully address the scope of the mold contamination problem.

defect: Quantifiable levels of genotoxic impurities in API batches.
claimed_cause: “Your investigation determined impurities were purged effectively, no further monitoring needed.”
fda_critique: Failed to investigate all critical deviations, including limit excursions.

defect: Presence of particles in vials leading to OOS results.
claimed_cause: Operator error during batch preparation, investigations failed to identify causes.
fda_critique: Your investigations failed to identify all potential contributing causes, consider the conclusions of an engineering study, and adequately document investigational activities.

defect: High water activity exceeding specifications, combined with microbial growth.
claimed_cause: Operator error/moisture in the formulation was the root cause.
fda_critique: Your investigation did not determine the root cause of the microbial failure or extend the investigation to determine if any additional lots may have been affected.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of DI deficiencies, including omissions, alterations, and deletions in data records and reporting.

defect: Scope pouches leaking during aging studies.
claimed_cause: Failure to identify root causes in CAPA investigations.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to adequately conduct and document CAPA investigations, including failing to determine the root cause of identified issues like “biopsy tools couldn’t pass through bronchoscope’s working channels” and failing to evaluate the extent of pouch leaks.

defect: Incomplete process validation studies and inadequate PPQ results.
claimed_cause: Lack of a validation plan is the root cause.
fda_critique: Your firm lacked an adequate process validation program and sufficient validation studies for your drug product manufacturing processes, failing to ensure reproducible products that meet specifications.

defect: NeoZoline Ventilation Tubes: Nonconforming tubes not inspected upon arrival.
claimed_cause: No risk to end users, postmarket surveillance data.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked adequate evaluation of nonconformities and failed to justify the rationale for not conducting related investigations.

defect: Visible contamination in media fill failure on filling line
claimed_cause: Operator activities related to a breach in tubing.
fda_critique: Your investigations lacked data supporting the assigned root cause(s), were not adequately expanded to include all potentially affected drug products, or were not formally documented in your deviation system.

defect: Microbiological contamination of purified water system.
claimed_cause: No product impact because subsequent water samples were within limits.
fda_critique: Your investigation did not adequately identify the root cause of the contamination of your water system with objectionable microorganisms and failed to consider the impact to your distributed drug products that were manufactured with contaminated water.

defect:
Cross-contamination of Pain Aid Extra Strength tablets with guaifenesin 

Cross-contamination of 3-Component Cold Tabs tablets with caffeine
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to scientifically identify the root cause of the contamination in multiple instances, relying instead on resampling and retesting with unvalidated methods until passing results were obtained.

defect: Rough metal surfaces and incomplete barriers in RABS systems.
claimed_cause: Improper verification of conduit, improper inspection procedures.
fda_critique: Your remediation activities failed to holistically address the conditions of the RABS, and your response did not evaluate the training of personnel responsible for inspection activities.

defect: Inaccuracies in data records and reporting.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of omissions, alterations, deletions, record destruction, and other deficiencies in the facility’s operations regarding data integrity.

defect: Inadequate health risk assessments and root cause analyses investigations.
claimed_cause: Root cause was identified as inadequate CAPA procedures and investigations.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked adequate root cause analyses and verification of effectiveness for critical CAPAs, including those resulting in Class I recalls.

defect: Failed assay test release specification for drug product units.
claimed_cause: Insufficient batch oversight due to scanning procedure.
fda_critique: Your firm did not provide a comprehensive corrective action and preventive action (CAPA) plan with a systematic approach to correct oversight deficiencies.

defect: Encrusted conductivity probe causing inaccurate conductivity results.
claimed_cause: Elevated ammonium chloride levels in Avicel were the root cause.
fda_critique: The investigation failed to thoroughly investigate OOS results, expand to all potentially affected lots, and implement adequate corrective and preventive actions.

defect: Residue, metal debris, and contamination on devices
claimed_cause: Your firm attributed the failure to inadequate verification/validation of corrective actions.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked a thorough verification or validation of corrective actions prior to implementation to ensure their effectiveness.

defect: 100% visual inspection directed in the procedure failed to investigate root causes.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked a thorough evaluation of the root causes and did not ensure corrective actions aligned with SOP-CAPS-4000317.

defect: Ink leaching into drug product solution
claimed_cause: Operator error/process failure during transfer tubing investigation.
fda_critique: You failed to thoroughly investigate any unexplained discrepancy or failure of a batch or any of its components to meet any of its specifications, including a review of other batches of drug products manufactured using the same tubing that may have been adversely affected.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm failed to conduct a retrospective review to ensure materials used for drug product testing were suitable for their intended use.

filename: ReNovo Inc. DBA Provision Device Reprocessing Solutions_1203.html
defect: Above-limit air particulate levels in medical devices.
claimed_cause: Air particulate levels above limits, no identified root cause.
fda_critique: Your firm did not assess if product may have been impacted by the air compressor failure or set acceptable levels for air particulate measurements.

defect: Out-of-specification assay and loss on ignition (LOI) test results.
claimed_cause: Staff turnover and insufficient training, lack of root cause definition.
fda_critique: Failed to describe a holistic review of all investigations’ root cause analyses and corrective actions for adequacy.

defect: Out-of-specification assay testing results for a batch.
claimed_cause: Your firm attributed the failure to laboratory errors.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment into the extent of the falsification of autoclave records and other breaches of data integrity occurring in the laboratory.

defect: Failed identity test on incoming primary raw material.
claimed_cause: Reliance on supplier COAs without adequate identity testing.
fda_critique: Failed to conduct an identity test on each lot of raw material used in the manufacture of your API.

defect: Metallic particles present in API exceeding detection limits
claimed_cause: No exact root cause identified; cleaning deficiency likely.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to adequately determine the root cause of metal contamination in your APIs, particularly regarding the qualification of your metal detector and the applicability of industry standards.

defect: Inadequate cleaning processes and verification, leading to contamination.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to adequately validate production and process controls, including a lack of assurance that products consistently meet quality attributes and a failure to consider critical factors like system maintenance and seasonal variations during validation efforts.

defect: Sample solution contamination during preparation of stability samples.
claimed_cause: Sample solution contamination during preparation.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked scientific and thorough root cause analysis, failing to identify the contaminant, its origin, or the cause of its presence within your samples.

defect: Premature retraction of butterfly needles, incorrect IFU designations.
claimed_cause:
Premature retraction, sterilization application, shelf-life failure. 
Incorrect IFU designations, rework, and distribution.
fda_critique: Your firm did not adequately investigate and correct all affected products identified in CAR C00050.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of your overall system for investigating deviations, discrepancies, complaints, and failures.

defect: Unlabeled vials of solution processed in HPLC system.
claimed_cause: Operator error (labeling, verification) and inadequate SOP revisions.
fda_critique: The investigation failed to determine the scope of the deficiency and provide a root cause analysis regarding the discarding and shredding of critical CGMP documents.

defect: Partially damaged capillary tubes due to machine failure.
claimed_cause: Equipment malfunction/failure of the “ (b)(4) ” machine.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked evidence of retroactive qualification and a systemic corrective action to ensure all equipment meets specified requirements and is appropriately qualified for its intended use.

defect: Out-of-specification (OOS) endotoxin results on surgical patties and Duraform lots
claimed_cause: Re-testing failed CV% exceeded limit.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked a thorough evaluation of the underlying causes for the repeated CV% exceedances and failures.

defect: Out-of-specification viscosity and specific gravity results.
claimed_cause: Inadequate OOS investigation; specification error and wrong criteria.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to thoroughly investigate out-of-specification results and discrepancies, including the release and distribution of batches with OOS viscosity and specific gravity results without an investigation or supporting evidence.

defect: Burkholderia contaminans contamination in water system ports
claimed_cause: Operator error, deviations, and lack of investigation/CAPA.
fda_critique: Failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained discrepancies, such as the identification of *Burkholderia contaminans* in multiple water system samples and staining within the water tank, resulting in a lack of documented corrective and preventative actions.

defect: Too Numerous to Count (TNTC) microbial counts in hand sanitizer.
claimed_cause: Inadequately robust procedures; lack thorough root cause investigation.
fda_critique: Your firm did not provide a thorough investigation into the microbial failures and failed to identify the root cause and implement appropriate corrective action strategies.

defect: Container-closure integrity issues and product leakage.
claimed_cause: Production personnel used the closure to fill products without addressing uncertainty.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained failures and their impact on potentially affected batches, particularly regarding container-closure integrity issues and product leakage.

defect: Out-of-specification (OOS) test result for tetracaine HCl potency.
claimed_cause: “Your firm attributed the failure to repeated testing achieving passing results.”
fda_critique: The firm failed to provide scientifically sound justification for repeatedly testing the sample until a passing result was achieved, despite an initial OOS test result using a compendial method.

defect: Out-of-specification (OOS) results for laboratory tests
claimed_cause: Inadequate investigation of OOS results and trends.
fda_critique: Failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained discrepancies and OOS results lacking adequate scientific rationale and root cause analyses.

defect: Particles from MDI valves lodged in actuators, blocking drug delivery.
claimed_cause: Particles from MDI valves blocked actuators; no root cause identified.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked appropriate and timely corrective actions and preventive actions, and failed to extend investigations to other potentially affected batches.

filename: CTK OTC Laboratories LLC formerly FMK LABS Inc._504.html
defect: Subpotent API concentration in bulk base batch
claimed_cause: Root cause not determined; inadequate investigation process.
fda_critique: Your investigations were inadequate because you failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained discrepancies and failures in drug products, including OOS results, without identifying root causes, implementing appropriate CAPA, or evaluating the impact on other batches.

defect: Crack in the filter of an administration set.
claimed_cause: No cause could be established; investigation not performed.
fda_critique: Your firm did not adequately review, evaluate, and investigate complaints involving device failures to meet specifications, often concluding investigations without returning the device or referencing prior investigations.

defect: Drug products released prior to completion of quality control testing.
claimed_cause: “Due to the belief that such could be proceeded to next step.”
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked a retrospective review to identify other instances of drug product release prior to completion of quality control testing.

defect: Bioburden excursions exceeding microbial action-level limits.
claimed_cause: Root cause was identified as “personnel” or “environment” without sufficient evidence.
fda_critique: Failed to adequately investigate microbial excursions and OOS endotoxin results, lacking scientifically justified root causes and a thorough risk assessment.

defect: Missing batch record pages, changed sample weight, and printout discrepancies.
claimed_cause: Inattention of manufacturing operators, analyst error.
fda_critique: Your investigations were inadequate due to failing to thoroughly investigate discrepancies and lack a root cause determination supported by evidence, leading to conclusions based on probable causes like operator inattention without sufficient evidence.

defect: Inadequate software validation for TENS/PMS Model SM9109A
claimed_cause: Lack of planning, inadequate evaluation, and insufficient documentation.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to adequately review previously manufactured devices for software validation and did not address the retrospective review needed to ensure compliance.

filename: Cangene BioPharma LLC dba Emergent BioSolutions_2180.html
defect: Particulate contamination of sterile drug products due to tray units.
claimed_cause: Manipulation of tray units led to metal particulates.
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked sufficient evaluation and documentation regarding the root cause of particulate contamination, particularly failing to adequately address the inadequate tray unit design and maintenance procedures.

defect: Burr on Impeller CP below target tolerance
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm failed to adequately validate corrective actions, specifically the software bug fix, to ensure it effectively addressed the issue and did not adversely affect the finished device.

defect: Out-of-specification assay results lacking adequate scientific justification.
claimed_cause: Sample preparation error without adequate scientific justification, defective dehumidifier.
fda_critique: Your investigations into out-of-specification assay results lacked adequate hypothesis testing and scientific justification for determining the root cause.

defect: Exceeded assay specification for active ingredient in tablets.
claimed_cause: Lack of stability testing, inconsistent disintegration testing, delayed stability study.
fda_critique: The company’s investigation failed to identify and address the 13 lots within expiry that exceeded the revised assay specification, and lacked a thorough investigation into the stability characteristics of drug products.

defect: Lack of proper drug listings with the FDA.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a complete assessment of the inaccuracies in data records and reporting, including a detailed description of the scope and root causes of the data integrity lapses.

defect: Contaminated microbiological samples and inaccurate data recording.
claimed_cause: Operator error, data breaches, and inadequate procedures.
fda_critique: The firm failed to fully consider the gaps and uncertainties in a retrospective review when there has been a significant adverse pattern of data that was overwritten, discarded, and unrecorded.

filename: Chemical Services Group Inc.Royal Chemical Company_1801.html
defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm’s investigation system lacked a comprehensive assessment and remediation plan to ensure effective investigation competencies, scope determination, root cause evaluation, and CAPA effectiveness.

defect: Bacterial contamination on MCH devices
claimed_cause: Tolerance stacking with device specifications at edges.
fda_critique: The firm’s investigation lacked adequate evaluation of contamination levels and causes, failing to investigate the bacterial contamination identified in complaints.

filename: Choice All Natural Inc. dba Om Botanical_851.html
defect: Candida parapsilosis contamination
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm failed to include results of an investigation into potentially contaminated drug product batches.

defect: TNTC bioburden results in bulk solutions/finished units
claimed_cause: Failure to evaluate root causes, batches released despite excursions.
fda_critique: The company’s investigation lacked a thorough evaluation to determine the root cause of excursions and failed to establish that its sterilization process could achieve its established minimum sterility assurance level when TNTC bioburden levels were present.

defect: White particles and glass particles exceeding action levels
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The firm failed to thoroughly investigate deviations and batch failures, particularly regarding the identification and source of particulates exceeding action levels.

defect: Incomplete batch production and control records lacking full testing results.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to expand their review to all drug products, in individual configurations, for lots previously distributed and within expiry, and did not investigate the root cause of incomplete documentation.

defect: Out-of-specification assay results for OTC drug products
claimed_cause: Your firm attributed the failure to inadequate OOS investigation procedures.
fda_critique: Failed to thoroughly investigate out-of-specification results and provide a retrospective review of invalidated OOS results over the past three years.

defect: Shorting of PCBs within the DxI 600/800 Analyzer
claimed_cause: Design change to PCB caused shorting.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked adequate assessment of the design change’s impact on other devices and failed to sufficiently identify the root cause related to design, verification, and validation processes.

defect: Unidentified colored particulates in repackaged glycerin, propylene glycol, and other components.
claimed_cause: Operator error, investigation failure, root cause not identified.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to adequately investigate over 100 lots contaminated with particulates and assess the safety risk of contaminated drugs released to customers.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The company’s investigation lacked a retrospective review to ensure appropriate labeling was on all products currently in distribution.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Lacked a comprehensive investigation into the root causes of contamination, including inadequate procedures for reviewing batch records, CAPA, and deviations.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked scientific justification for concluding operator error and failed to adequately address potential manufacturing root causes.

defect: Bacillus cereus contamination in porcine thyroid API
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked sufficient detail regarding the root causes of contamination and failed to investigate all lots with potential objectionable microbial contamination or OOS results.

defect: Significant particulate contamination in sterile injection solution.
claimed_cause: “Highly possible” washing/sterilization issues, formulation source, inadequate CAPA.
fda_critique: Failed to adequately investigate both extrinsic and intrinsic particulate contamination issues, including the root cause and implementing a timely and effective CAPA.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to provide copies of the updated change control form and Standard Operating Procedure for review, and did not commit to a systematic retrospective review of changes and their impact on drug analyses.

defect: Visible particulate contamination in sterile ophthalmic drug products
claimed_cause: Operator error and lack of process control identified.
fda_critique: The company’s investigation failed to thoroughly investigate the root causes of visible particulate contamination and excessive defects, lacking a commitment to remediate a low-capability process and prevent further contaminated batches from being produced.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of omissions, alterations, deletions, record destruction, and other deficiencies within the facility’s operations regarding data integrity.

defect: Failed sterility test results from testing (b)(4)
claimed_cause: “Investigation concluded ‘causes unrelated to the product’ were invalid.”
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked sufficient justification for repeating the sterility test and failing to verify effectiveness for previously closed SCARs.

defect: Average 58% ethanol concentration in hand sanitizer product.
claimed_cause: The investigation concluded the subpotency was limited to one batch.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked adequate scientific justification to support the conclusion that the subpotent issue was limited to only the FDA-tested batch and failed to expand the investigation to include all impacted products and batches.

defect: Out-of-specification (OOS) results for content uniformity
claimed_cause: Suboptimal process performance was the root cause identified.
fda_critique: Your firm did not provide assurance that batches released to the U.S. market, manufactured before validation, are of the appropriate strength and quality.

defect: Foreign particles introduced as a result of the manufacturing process.
claimed_cause: Sampling procedure as the potential root cause.
fda_critique: Your investigations lacked an adequate root cause analysis to assess all sources of variability in your manufacturing process that could be contributing to failures, particularly regarding cleaning procedures and the potential for masking failing testing results.

filename: Chromatography Institute of America dba Compounders International Analytical Laboratory_334.html
defect: Failed sterility test – microbial growth detected
claimed_cause: Technician error – environmental contamination
fda_critique: You did not adequately investigate the multiple failed sterility test results by failing to support the “technician error – environmental contamination” root cause with supporting environmental monitoring data.

defect: Microbial excursions in drug product lots failing specifications
claimed_cause: “Unknown laboratory error” and “contamination of an unknown source.”
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked sufficient scientific justification to conclude “unknown laboratory error” and failed to adequately investigate potential contamination sources.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED (The letter focuses on documentation and investigation practices, not a specific product defect.)
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to conduct at least one test to verify the identity of each component of a drug product and failed to validate and establish the reliability of component supplier’s test analyses.

defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to ensure complete data derived from necessary tests and accurately collected environmental and personnel monitoring samples, leading to fabricated or altered results.

defect: Multiple objectionable microorganisms (Pseudomonas, Ralstonia, Paracoccus) in water.
claimed_cause: Laboratory error related to sample contamination was the root cause.
fda_critique: Failed to adequately investigate and assess the impact of microbial contamination, particularly regarding water system performance and finished product quality.

defect: Different infrared (IR) spectrum of naphazoline HCl API.
claimed_cause: You stated that a new lab IR test conformed to the standard.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to initiate an investigation to determine a root cause for the unknown peaks that were detected in your finished drug product batches and implement a CAPA to prevent reoccurrence.

defect: Lack of growth promotion testing of microbiological media.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Failed to conduct growth promotion testing of microbiological media and independently verify supplier certificates of analysis, leading to inadequate assurance of component suitability.

defect: Objectionable microorganisms detected in the water system.
claimed_cause: Lack of investigation, inadequate procedures, and unqualified water system.
fda_critique: Failed to conduct adequate investigations into the presence of objectionable microorganisms and other excursions in their water system.

defect: Atypical drug core release rate exceeding specification.
claimed_cause: Failure to investigate discrepancies, lacking root cause analysis.
fda_critique: Failed to consistently conduct investigations in a timely manner to ensure other batches were not similarly affected.

defect: Out-of-specification microbiological testing results for Pseudomonas aeruginosa
claimed_cause: Operator error during batch preparation, inadequate investigation.
fda_critique: Your investigation did not adequately assess additional drug products that may have been affected by the microbiological contamination.

defect: Broken tablets caused by packaging equipment malfunction.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to extend to other potentially affected batches and implement CAPA plans to prevent recurring issues.

defect: False negative/positive readings from device analysis strips
claimed_cause: Complaint handling was informally managed by the sales department.
fda_critique: Your firm did not include a description or evidence that the specific complaints identified in the FDA 483 have been investigated.

defect: Inappropriately designed vial filling equipment introduced metallic particles.
claimed_cause: Friction from damaged equipment introduced metallic particles during filling.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to adequately address the continued use of damaged and inappropriately designed equipment, including a lack of risk assessment for the lifecycle control of manufacturing equipment.

filename: Siddha Flower Essences LLC. dba Siddha Remedies_118.html
defect: Microbiological contamination of aqueous drug products
claimed_cause: Lack qualified personnel, insufficient oversight, and unclear root cause.
fda_critique: The investigation failed to thoroughly investigate out-of-limit microbiological results and identify root causes, lacking a clear timeline and interim plans for drug production until the full scope of impact was determined.

defect: Lack of process validation, including inadequate microbiological testing.
claimed_cause: Inadequate written procedures, process validation, and lack of specifications.
fda_critique: The firm failed to adequately review all batches distributed prior to testing, ensuring they met appropriate specifications for identity, strength, quality, and purity.

defect: Out-of-specification assay results for salicylic acid.
claimed_cause: Lack of resources/personnel to investigate; no root cause.
fda_critique: Failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained OOS assay results and determine a root cause or assess the impact of the results.

defect: Carryover of precedent assay reagents causing erroneous analyzer results
claimed_cause: Ambiguity in risk analysis, lack of responsibility, file maintenance issues.
fda_critique: Your firm did not adequately address the root cause of carryover issues by failing to provide copies of the risk management files for review and lacking a clear explanation of how the revised job description will prevent similar failures.

defect: Stagnant liquid with microbial contamination in equipment.
claimed_cause: Faulty valve failure was the root cause identified.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to provide a comprehensive, independent retrospective assessment of cleaning effectiveness to evaluate the scope of cross-contamination hazards.

defect: Not specified
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked adequate validation of the SpiroSonic Mobile Software V1.16 and the cleaning and disinfection process for SpiroThor, with no documented rationale or new procedure provided.

defect: Out-of-specification assay test failing to meet release specification.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your firm failed to establish a quality control unit with the authority and procedures necessary to effectively oversee all aspects of drug product quality and investigate OOS results.

defect: Visible particulate contamination in injectable products
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The company’s investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of its overall system for investigating deviations and failures, including significant improvements in scope determination, root cause evaluation, and CAPA effectiveness.

defect: Not having written down test results/data records.
claimed_cause: NOT STATED
fda_critique: The company’s investigation was inadequate because it failed to perform a sufficient retrospective review of investigations and data retention deficiencies.

defect: Persistent contamination of objectionable microorganisms (gram-negative, spore formers)
claimed_cause: Operators talking and staff illness; non-functional injector syringe.
fda_critique: Your investigation into the trend of gram-negative organisms was inadequate because it did not provide a holistic evaluation of all potential contamination sources and personnel practices contributing to the adverse trend.

defect: Lack of appropriate controls in UV-Vis spectrophotometer computer system.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked sufficient details regarding security features, user access levels, and data integrity measures for computerized analytical instrumentation systems.

defect: Damaged retainer rings in insulin infusion pumps
claimed_cause: Risk calculation formula underestimated probability of harm.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to accurately calculate the risk associated with the failed retainer rings, resulting in an inappropriate risk classification.

defect: Inaccurate and incomplete data records related to manufacturing.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of the extent of inaccuracies in data records and reporting, including root causes and potential risks to drug quality and patient safety.

filename: System Kosmetik Produktionsgesellschaft fur kosmetische Gmbh_2087.html
defect: NOT SPECIFIED
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The firm failed to exercise appropriate controls over computer or related systems to assure data integrity, specifically lacking unique usernames and passwords and disabling the audit trail function on a routinely used FTIR system.

defect: Cracked caps with tissue caught in the device tip.
claimed_cause: Lack of linkage between scopes and caps.
fda_critique: Your firm did not adequately investigate why the complaint regarding esophageal trauma and cracked caps was not initiated within the required 30-day timeframe.

defect: Inaccuracies in data records and reporting.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of the extent of data integrity deficiencies, including omissions, alterations, and deletions from raw data and results.

defect: Out-of-specification assay results for chloroxylenol concentration.
claimed_cause: Failure to investigate OOS results, lack of testing strategy.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a thorough investigation into unexplained OOS assay results and failed to ensure consistent production of safe and effective products.

defect: Out-of-specification dissolution results for tablets
claimed_cause: Inadequate investigations; failure to identify root causes.
fda_critique: Failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained discrepancies, OOS results, and failures, lacking sufficient scientific justification and detailed corrective action plans.

defect: Out-of-specification assay results for desmopressin acetate tablets
claimed_cause: Lack of defined compression parameters attributed to the content uniformity failure.
fda_critique: Your investigations into rejected batches failed to extend to other batches, dosage strengths, and drug products for tablet compression machine settings.

defect: Inadequate oversight of drug product quality and specifications.
claimed_cause: Operator error, inadequate oversight, and insufficient procedures.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment and remediation plan to ensure adequate quality oversight and a robust system for investigating deviations and failures.

defect: Microbial excursions exceeding limits in the manufacturing system.
claimed_cause: Sampling error, supervisor change, no product impact stated.
fda_critique: You failed to provide a retrospective review of your microbial results and lack a risk assessment of all products that may have been affected by OOS results.

defect: Breast discomfort/pain, erythema, itching sensation, burning sensation, infection, scar tissue
claimed_cause: No justification for severity level 4/5 CAPA delay.
fda_critique: Your firm did not calculate the occurrence rate accurately when evaluating a spike of BioZorb medical device complaints and Medical Device Reports, nor did it provide sufficient instructions for calculating an accurate occurrence rate when complaint spikes and adverse trends are identified.

defect: Black particles in API batches
claimed_cause: Non-metallic charred product residue.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to provide documented data to support your conclusions regarding the root cause of black particles in the API batches.

filename: Owens  Minor Inc. dba American Contract Systems Inc._825.html
defect: Sterilization bag lots failed thickness requirements.
claimed_cause: Operator error during bag acceptance and design verification activities.
fda_critique: Your response did not provide a systemic description of how your firm will prevent this significant failure from recurring.

defect: Foul odor in foaming hand sanitizer formulation water.
claimed_cause: “Checked inventory and reworked product to lessen the smell.”
fda_critique: Your investigation lacked meaningful corrective action and preventive action to prevent recurrence, failing to address why the formulation water had a foul odor.

defect: Claims in Instructions for Use (IFUs) deviate from Agency clearance.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: Your response did not adequately address the creation of a procedure for CAPA activities or your plan to document corrective and preventive actions.

defect: Recalcitrant biofilm development in a non-recirculating water system.
claimed_cause: Recalcitrant biofilm development due to stagnant, non-recirculating water.
fda_critique: Your firm failed to conduct timely and comprehensive investigations into out-of-limit microbiological results, including documenting root cause determinations and product impact assessments.

defect: Broken/damaged/wet products, leaking bottles, and particle contamination in diluent.
claimed_cause: “Excessive heat” from induction sealer settings caused polymer melting.
fda_critique: The investigation lacked extending its evaluation to determine root causes, identifying other potentially affected products, and implementing corrective actions, particularly regarding open CAPAs like 21-002 and 21-001.

defect: Leaking container-closure systems allowing microbiological ingress.
claimed_cause: Lack of comprehensive investigation; root cause not stated.
fda_critique: The company’s investigation lacked comprehensive details, root cause analysis, and sufficient testing, including sterility testing, regarding the contamination of its Artificial Tears and Artificial Eye Ointment products.

filename: S  J International Enterprises Public Company Limited_1304.html
defect: Lack of legible labeling and a raw material OOS entry.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked complete and attributable batch records, and failed to provide legible documentation, including photographic evidence, upon request.

defect: Failed investigation of adverse reaction complaint regarding Chlordiazepoxide HCl/Clidinium Br.
claimed_cause: CMO was no longer in business, no cause identified.
fda_critique: Failed to provide evidence of their investigation into the product quality impact of the complaint, including the two batches of Chlordiazepoxide HCl and Clidinium Br, 5 mg/2.5 mg manufactured since 2018.

defect: Out-of-trend and out-of-specification dissolution results for tablets
claimed_cause: HPLC column leakage, improper sample set sequence, and OOS results.
fda_critique: Your investigations lacked adequate scientific rationale and failed to thoroughly investigate unexplained discrepancies or out-of-specification results.

defect: Out-of-specification (OOS) camphor assay release testing results
claimed_cause: Operator error, inadequate procedures, and insufficient quality oversight.
fda_critique: Your investigation failed to adequately investigate potential manufacturing deficiencies that led to out-of-specification test results and subsequent batch releases.

defect: Inaccuracies in data records and reporting.
claimed_cause: NONE IDENTIFIED
fda_critique: The investigation lacked a comprehensive assessment of the extent of data integrity deficiencies, including omissions, alterations, and deletions from data records.
